subject: Re: [junit] Testing XML and XSLT
msgSnippet: ... Hash: SHA1 Hi, ... Sorry, I responded to the wrong posting. Please accept my excuse for this. ... ;-) Bye - -- ITCQIS GmbH Christian Wolfgang Hujer
messageBody:
-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

Hi,

Am Mittwoch, 2. April 2003 23:27 schrieb Vladimir R. Bossicard:
> > > Do I really have to repeat myself over and over again?
> >
> > No, because the question was about XML and your solution won't work for
> > several reasons:
> > 1. The indention may be different.
> > 2. The sequence of the attributes may be different.
> > 3. The result may have attributes that are allowed but not mandatory.
> > 4. The encoding might be different.
> >
> > A string compare can only be done on exclusively canonized XML.
>
> Did anyone hear my saying "String comparison"? If this is the case, then I
> have to shout out louder.
Sorry, I responded to the wrong posting. Please accept my excuse for this.

> But if you want, you can do a string comparison.
;-)

Bye
